title: Twitter Rolls Out Blue Checkmarks for Paying Customers
description: Twitter Inc. said it has begun rolling out software updates to charge users $7.99 a month to mark their accounts with a blue checkmark, part of Elon Musk’s early efforts to boost revenue a little more than a week after taking ownership of the social-media network.

title: First Week of Elon Musk's Twitter Was Chaos and Confusion for Employees
description: Inside Twitter Inc. in the week after Elon Musk took it over, almost no one seemed to know for sure what was going on.

title: What Happened When One School Took Smartphones Away From the Kids
description: Nearly two months after the ban, students are getting used to life without social media and the drama of group texts—even if not all of them love it.

title: Why Elon Musk's Quest to Revive Twitter Is Likely to Fail
description: Musk’s strategy at Twitter might work at a startup, but Twitter is a mature company in an extremely competitive market, with little prospects for growth.
